messages.subject: Re: Writing (practically conjugation)
messages.msgSnippet: LOL! Boy, you really have to be careful what you put out into the public domain--you never know who might be lurking around your blog ready to quote you to
messages.messageBody:
LOL!

Boy, you really have to be careful what you put out into the public domain--you never
know who might be lurking around your blog ready to quote you to total strangers! ;-)

Thanks, I just got my giggle for the day.....
Joanna

--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...> wrote:
>
> Perhaps it's genetic, but Holly is practically conjugating verbs here
> (in a bit of poetic writing I took from her MySpace):
>
> "I like smiles, smiling and things that make me smile. I like farts,
> farting and things that makes me fart."
>
> That's it. That's her description/bio today. My lovely, farting
> daughter.
>
> Sandra
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>

messages.subject: Writing (practically conjugation)
messages.msgSnippet: Perhaps it s genetic, but Holly is practically conjugating verbs here (in a bit of poetic writing I took from her MySpace): I like smiles, smiling and things
messages.messageBody:
Perhaps it's genetic, but Holly is practically conjugating verbs here
(in a bit of poetic writing I took from her MySpace):

"I like smiles, smiling and things that make me smile. I like farts,
farting and things that makes me fart."

That's it. That's her description/bio today. My lovely, farting
daughter.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
